creator: pierre.delisle@sun.com
text:
If you try the JSP page included below, (call it test.jsp) with cookies disabled in your browser, you'll get the following links (modulo the context path): /standard-examples/test.jsp?foo=bar /standard-examples/test.jsp;jsessionid=2E90D2BBD0180E2D92A9F2EC87E736D9?foo=bar The first one works fine, the second one gets you to tomcat's default page. (tested with the nightly of 4-28-2003) The bug does not exist with tomcat-4.1.24. ---- test.jsp ------ <% String context = request.getContextPath(); String url1 = context + "/test.jsp?foo=bar"; String url2 = response.encodeURL(url1); %> <%=url1%>
<%=url2%>

creator: remm@apache.org

This is specific to jsessionid (changing that value to something else won't
work). The code which strips it is very bad anyway, so this will be a good
opportunity to rewrite it efficiently.
